result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal L. Domka

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Crystal L. Domka in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Crystal L. Domka in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF57, 15CF477

1:32 p.m.  Court calls the cases and states the appearances.  

Court questions if plea was entered on 15CF477.  
Atty Constable makes statements to the Court.  Based on the agreement, moves to dismiss and read-in 15CF477. 
Atty Drengler concurs. 

BY THE COURT:  15CF477 is dismissed but read-in. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  
5 years prison with 2 1/2 years initial confinement followed by 2 1/2 years extended supervision:
No contact with Jessica Helminiak.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Get all medications from one (1) pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases of information so the agent can monitor all forms of treatment she is under and medications she is prescribed. 
Provide list of medications to her agent.
Comply with any other assessment, treatment or programming deemed appropriate by the DOC. 
Complete a Psychological assessment, if one is not done in prison, and comply with treatment recommendations. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Obtain/maintain fulltime employment or schooling or combination of both to the extent she is medically able. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Comply with Aftercare program in terms of substance abuse. 
Eligible for Earned Release and Challenge Incarceration programs AFTER 14 months. 

Parties retain the PSI confidentially in their files. 

Written explanation of determinate sentence is provided to the defendant.
Court advises post-conviction.

Defendant Crystal L. Domka in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Crystal L. Domka in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:51 p.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.  
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and knowling waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 


State files Information.
Defendant's attorney received copy of information.
Defendant's atty waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Atty Drengler presents a bond argument to the court.  Requests a reduction to signature bond.  
ADA Cousins responds.  
Court believes the $500 bond is appropriate and does not modify it.

3:56 p.m. case is concluded.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Crystal L. Domka appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT: Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
$500 cash bond: Comply with the terms of any other pending bonds.

ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Bail JUmp.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond  with conditions as stated.
BTC: $500 cash bond: Comply with the terms of any other pending bonds.
Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 12-28-15   @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
